name: Store Champ Münster
description: Winning deck of the Store Championships in Münster, Germany, at 02. March 2014. The deck went 5-0. Fear and Loathing was not legal for this tournament.

name: RP requires tax
description:
This is a pure and simple taxation deck.

The idea is is to simply play the tax vs economy game in order to make scoring windows.

A single nisei is easy to turn into a Pri Req if the runner needs most of his turn to make money to actually get into your remote. False lead can also chain into making an easy score of a Pri Req or another Nisei.

IAA of Unorthodox Predictions can also give you a safe Nisei if you Adv, score, Install Advance a nisei behind a now unbreakable piece of ice. They are great Archer food.

Yes, there is nothing besides Junebug that is particularly jinteki in this deck, however, I think it plays a lot better into RP's ability of wasting time forcing central runs.

The Ice distribution is a tough nut for me, dont know if I need to make space for Tolbooth or maybe another Archer. The three single subroutine Barriers are also not my favourite. Almost everything else is ETR with multiple subroutines. Reducing the effectiveness of effient breakers that rely on high strength.

name: Whizzard-Agro.
description: Usual deck.

name: HB Rush and FA
Red Roundabout
description: Jinteki distract and decay

name: Next Gen Fast Advance v2.0
description:
Token placement is the latest fashion, when it comes to fast advance. Shipment from SanSan and Trick of Light both work perfectly with Efficiency Committee, by placing extra tokens when you're not technically allowed to advance a card anymore.

Cerebral Imaging main advantage lies in the protection that the big number of cards offers to your HQ, and by scoring each Agenda in one turn, you won't ever need to build remote servers. That's also part of the reason behind the removal of Jackson Howard from this deck. The other part being the new Blue Level Clearance, that together with the old little brother GLC provides enough extra draw as it is. Adding Archived Memories means you'll get back immediately the few cards you might need to recover.

What you have to do in this deck is quite simple:

  1. score an Efficiency Committee in one turn by installing an using any combination of Biotic Labor and Trick of Light to fast advance it.

  2. keep scoring the other points you need by fast advancing them any way you can, but mainly with the ECQ hosted agenda counters.

It might take some time to get all the stuff you need, but there are some very heavy pieces of ICE and plenty of economy cards to allow for some respite between attacks on your HQ and/or R&D.

Also, Hudson might help if you face an opponent who tries to rush a victory by attacking R&D early on. Keep in mind it won't stop indexing, though!

Not many Code Gate-type pieces of ICE, since Yog.0 would be too much of a pain otherwise, but some very nasty stuff nonetheless, like Wotan, Janus, Ichi 2.0 and Heimdall 2.0.

Manage your economy wisely!

name: DANGER ZONE! (looking for feedback)
description:
this is the deck I cannot wait to play. The silhouette version of my blackguard snitch deck. Inside jobs for emergences, same old thing recursion of infiltration and e shutdown. Looking for feedback. Also I have been utilizing crash space instead of plascrete so I can keep my money from my siphons to install blackguard.

Lana! LANA! LAAAANNNNAAAA! Danger ZONE!

name: Headslaughter
description: HQ targeting anarchy

name: RUN OR DIE
Custom Biotics - Shattered Public Image and Broken Rigs
description: This deck aims to utterly ruin a runners rig, halting their progress and forcing them to spend credits on recovering it as opposed to spending credits on breaking ice and event runs. The punitive counterstrike is in there for a surprise kill which is aided by the fact the majority of my agendas are 3 pointers. This deck sort of plays like a dredge deck from magic the gathering, heavily relying on retrieving things from my heap when needed. If I can overscore a project vitruvius I am in a very good position, however I can do without it with the help of Archived Memories and Jackson Howard. Typically I wont even bother using jackson to protect my agendas in my archives, rather I will have him put cards back in my deck after a power shutdown. NEVER REZZED SNOOP IN A GAME TO DATE BUT I AM REALLY LOOKING FORWARD TO THE DAY THAT I DO AND TEST IT OUT. This deck will make you take a TON of bad pub, but all the bad pub in the world won't matter if the runner doesn't have a breaker to use it with. I'd love to try this deck out with Weyland, but it is difficult considering the Haas Bioroid cards I use take up a lot of influence. Thoughts are appreciated!

name: Exile Pawn Engine
description: My take on the Exile-Pawn draw engine. Get Pawn/Scheherazade/Deep out and run as much as you can. If they have a server with only one ice, each run you make nets you 1 credit and 1 card. Use the all-purpose breaker suite to get into the places you need. Recur imp if they run asset econ. Trash 'dead draws' with Aesops for cash.

name: CT: Blackmail
Jurassic Park
The Night's Watch
Roulette
description: If you pull your Counterstrikes early, advance a Fetal unprotected and flat-line them when they take it, otherwise build defenses and conserve your kill cards to let them eat some net-damage then finish them off. If you get a scoring server setup, play install, then 3x advance and alternate in Junebugs if the runner wants to run them, or use the window to be able to put down another net damage. I've killed by having an un-advanced Clone Retirement in in play to deal the last damage. Bonus points for showing the opponent a Priority Req and 3x Counter-strikes with a Celebrity Gift.

name: OCP (1st Place Salt Store Tournament) ESP
Cyber-Cypher-Atman (1st Salt Store Tournament) ESP
Brainwash 1.0
description:
This deck is made to slowing grind the runner's teeth.

In early game, you try to hit at least one fast agenda and you secure your economy assets with any "end the run" ice. Letting some of your assets without any ice as Eve and PAD is 4 and 5. At this stage this is where Fenris shine. Wraparound is perfect because it could stop any early Atman or Crysis.

In mid game, if possible you have enough money to start pulling a big ice on a remote with BER or with a good combo to slow him down. You should be able to score another one agenda there too. You could try trap him at this stage with CO or EoW depending of your central and your cards in hand.

Before you enter the stage where the runner have all the tools he need to go through your defences, you should have scored as fast as you can all agenda you found.

In later game, you want Ruhr Valley out to stop him with Janus or Heimdall 2.0. This is where your trap as a better chance to work. With chance, you could remove him a crucial ice breaker to go for the win.

This is the first version of it. I'm going to try it out with a proxy ID so I could make better version.

I'm Hoping that your vote is going for this Chronos Protocol so we could engineering the futur with blank memories.

name: TWIB* - 1st place 2014 San Rafael Store Championship
Sharp Edges HB
description: Play ice tricks to score early brain damage. Most of the assets are high trash cost. Hopefully hit the runner with an Edge of the world behind some cheap ice.

name: Homeless Kasparov v3
description:
This is a combo deck based around 3 cards, Pawn, Scheherazade and Deep Red. Please read about the strategy and combo here: http://netrunomicon.com/b003/

This is a tweaked version of this deck to increase tempo and initial aggression, as I found that MO was both too slow and just not used enough during the game to be worth it. So I replaced it with Armitage to increase speed

I've replaced Kati with Aesops and I need clicks rather than pure money, and Æsop combos great with both Armitage, Daily Casts and even the leftover SMC or first pawn you play on your Scheherazade.

I've removed a Knight and added an Imp instead, in order to somewhat counter combo and Fast Advance decks, as initial Sansans or full HQ with Operations is difficult to crack. The Imp further combos with Æsop, Scavenge and Scheherazade which is also very nice.

v3 Replaces RDI with Indexing to keep up early preessure and adds a sharpshooter to save me from destroyers.

name: Time Bandit
description:
Pretty simple idea. Score an early Nisei MK II or False lead with chimera/bastion. Put out Pad Campaigns, Sundews, JH, Snares and Ruhr valley but don't rez until you have a lot of cards out. This is a good way to sneak out a braintrust. Snares often discourages nosy runners to check every card you put out, most of the time they don't risk checking every asset after hitting one. Junebug & Thomas for making wealthy runners spend credits on two (Central+Remote) taxing runs in vain (especially nice if put in rezzed Ruhr-server).

When the time comes throw down and double advance an Executive Retreat in a server with Ruhr. Forfeiting false lead after they run a central = 1 click left, not enough to run your remote. If you have a Nisei and they run your Ruhr-remote, end the run when they've gone through all ice = 1 click left, they can't run it again. A totally safe 3-pointer! Best when ending the game since runners tend to forget to do the math/about the Nisei counter when they're excited. Extremely satisfying when runners realize they were shut out from beginning and just wasted their turn on nothing ;)

Had thoughts about putting Strongbox in but realized that it doesn't work very well with the Executive end game scoring part of the strategy so took it out and put in some vipers and anti-tag float instead.

name: CT Hates Fast Advance
description: First off, let me be clear that I have yet to test this deck at all. Basically me just trying to smash two different gimmicks that I've wanted to try into one deck. LLDS & cheap program recursion + The Source & Chakana for slow advancement. Is that a good idea? Probably not, but here we are.

name: Ash's Fast Advance
description: Use Ash to protect your FA server and win quick.

name: GRNDL Off the Grid
description: Supposedly this deck will let you jump to an early ICE lead on HQ allowing you to set up Off the Grid.
